content:
Good morning. I wish you a happy New Year!
I have a simple question.
When a Dataverse's user publishes a Dataset and, after that, changes the Dataset's file access permissions, two Datasets are created, one in 'Draft' state and another one in 'Published' state?
Thanks in advance.
sender_full_name: AdÃ­lia Isabel Domingues da Cruz Alves

content: Yes, that sounds right. The draft gives a preview of the new permissions. After you published the draft, it goes away. And now you have two versions of the dataset. It's been a while since I played with this but I believe that's how it works.

Philip Durbin said:

Yes, that sounds right. The draft gives a preview of the new permissions. After you published the draft, it goes away. And now you have two versions of the dataset. It's been a while since I played with this but I believe that's how it works.

Thank you Philip for your precious help :-).
sender_full_name: AdÃ­lia Isabel Domingues da Cruz Alves

content: Sure, if it helps, you'll never have more than one draft.
You "stage" your changes in a draft. Usually changes to metadata or files. Sometimes file permissions.
As this is not container related, I'm gonna move this to #troubleshooting
This topic was moved here from #containers > Dataset duplication by Oliver Bertuch.
